Comment 2: 
This comes up with non-init functions too. I think we should have a compiler flag -X
that means 'there are no external (non-Go) files in this package', and if that flag is
set, complain about forward declarations as if they were not part of the language.

Then the go command can invoke 6g with -X when it knows there are no non-Go files in the
package.
